bibl.title: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 7, 1908

div1.p: Mabel Lazear writes that the pension bill has passed the Senate. She also relates family news.

div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 7, 1908
div1.p:
Many
thanks for the check which
came to- day - and for
your telegram- I should
have thanked you for
it the day it came but
you will understand
when I tell you Emma
is on a vacation.
Mother is getting ready
to go away this Wednesday
and I Thursday-

After you sent your
telegram - that was the
first that I knew it had
passed the Senate we
checked in the S. F. papers and
found a notice of it-
Then I had a telegram
from Dr Mansfelde
saying it had passed
the Senate and to-
day a long letter from
him saying every thing
was being done to get
it through the House

I have many letters from
the New York Merchants
Association- They have done
so very much.

We were so sorry
to know that you have
been so very poorly.
Neuritis is dreadful - I
do wish you were able
to come to Cal.- the climate
would be so much better
for it.-

There is great excitement
in Santa Barbara over the coming of the fleet
we are to have a great
flower fête -- tues
AC
L
Graham gives a big ball
to which she was kind
enough to ask me but I
am not going-

I can send only a short
letter- I have to get off
several before I leave-
We will get our mail
just the same-

We go to Laurel Spring-
They send a carriage for
us - it is only a four or
five hour drive- I can
telephone to Santa Barbara
at any time- If it is near it
is on top of the mountain or
I think it will be a change
This goes with many thanks
and much love from
